trans-unit.source: Represents a Workflow role that is backed by a <xref href="System.Web.Security.RoleProvider"></xref>.
For more information about roles in ASP.NET, see [Role Providers](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96709).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref> class by using the specified role name.
A string that defines the name of the role.
roleName contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref> class by using the specified role name and role provider.
The most commonly used role providers for <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole> are classes that inherit from <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider>.
These classes include <xref:System.Web.Security.AuthorizationStoreRoleProvider>, <xref:System.Web.Security.SqlRoleProvider> and <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider>.
A string that defines the name of the role.
A string that defines the role provider.
roleName contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Returns a generic list of ASP.NET accounts associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref>.
<xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> supports only <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles.IsUserInRole%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles.GetRolesForUser%2A>.

Furthermore, it supports these methods only for the user account that is currently the WindowsPrincipal associated with the request context, so you cannot call <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles.GetRolesForUser%2A> for any user account in the domain.
When using the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole.GetIdentities%2A> method with the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider>, the following provider exception is thrown:
The configured Role Provider (WindowsTokenRoleProvider) relies upon Windows authentication to determine the groups that the user is allowed to be a member of.
ASP.NET Role Manager cannot be used to manage Windows users and groups.
Use the SQLRoleProvider if you want to support custom user/role assignment.
A generic list of string values that represent the ASP.NET accounts associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref>.
Returns a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref> contains the specified identity
The name of the identity to test for.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref> contains the specified identity; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref>.
A string that contains the name of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole.Name"></xref> was set to a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Gets or sets the role provider for the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref>.
The most commonly used role providers for <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole> are classes that inherit from <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider>.
These classes include <xref:System.Web.Security.AuthorizationStoreRoleProvider>, <xref:System.Web.Security.SqlRoleProvider> and <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider>.
A string that contains the role provider for the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WebWorkflowRole"></xref>.
